revised_title: Configurations of Rotating Compressible Masses and their Astronomical Implications
tldr: This article explores the configurations of rotating compressible masses, focusing on the equilibrium shapes and densities of celestial bodies. The author discusses the impact of compressibility and non-homogeneity on the shapes of astronomical matter, providing a detailed study of the configurations possible when the compressibility is such that pressure and density are connected by a specific law. The findings have important implications for understanding the structure and behavior of stars and other celestial bodies.
